newsitem.title: CANADA: Magna Intl shares fall on U.S. selling.
newsitem.headline: Magna Intl shares fall on U.S. selling.

text.p: Shares in auto parts maker Magna International Inc tumbled in morning trade on Wednesday after an aggressive U.S. seller shed a large amount of stock, traders said.
"I think there was an aggressive seller out of the (United) States," said one trader.

"The selling was all institutionally driven," he added. The trader said Schroeder Wertheim crossed a two million share block in New York. Another dealer said there was no more to the transaction than one institution wanting to sell a block of stock and a syndicate wanting to buy.
Magna shares fell to 70.40 on the Toronto Stock Exchange before retracing slightly to trade down 2.00 at 70.80 with 1.86 million shares swapping hands.
In New York, Magna was down 1-5/8 at 52-1/8, up from a trough of 51-3/4, on turnover of 2.32 million shares.
((Sarah Edmonds, Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8100, E-mail sarah.edmonds@reuters.com))
